taskbody.heading: Welcome to our experiment
taskbody.body:
Hello and welcome to an online survey conducted by the Nuremberg Institute for Market Decisions, a not-for-profit organization for researching consumer and marketing decisions, as well as the founder and anchor shareholder of GfK SE.

With your help, we aim to investigate how `SYCL 2023` resonates with its attendees. Participation is voluntary.

The data collected will be anonymized and used exclusively for research purposes, and all analyses will be carried out in such a way that no conclusions from the results can be drawn about the individual taking part.

The survey will take about 5 minutes of your time. You will be asked questions about your experience at `SYCL 2023`.

### To participate in the study, please note the following:

- Please participate in the experiment **without interruption**. We have set a **maximum time of 30 minutes** for each respondent to participate.

- You can only participate in the experiment **once**. The link will expire as soon as you join the experiment.

- Please **do not use the "Back"-button of your browser**.

Thank you very much for your support.

`If you would like to participate in this study, please confirm the statements below and then click "Continue"`.
taskbody.agreement_check_caption: Yes, I would like to participate in the study
taskbody.please_check_agreement_msg: Please agree to the study participation
taskbody.data_protection_body: ## Data protection and privacy The survey is conducted by the Nürnberg Institut für Marktentscheidungen e.V. ("NIM") for the Nürnberg Institut für Marktentscheidungen e.V. ("Client"). You will find information on data protection below. ## Consent I hereby consent that the information provided by me within the survey may be processed by NIM for the purpose of evaluating the survey and made available to the client. I am aware that I can withdraw my consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out on the basis of the consent until the withdrawal. ## Privacy Statement Within the scope of the survey, the greatest importance is given to compliance with data protection regulations as well as the confidentiality of the data. We strictly adhere to all applicable laws and regulations on data protection, in particular the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG) and the German Telemedia Act (TMG). With this privacy statement, we inform you about the processing of your personal data and the rights to which you are entitled. ## Controller Nürnberg Institut für Marktentscheidungen e.V. Steinstrasse 21 90419 Nürnberg Germany Tel. +49 911 9 51 51 983 Fax +49 911 37677 872 hello@nim.org ## Data Protection Officer If you have any questions to our data protection officer about data protection, please email us at mail@nim.org. Alternatively, you can also send your request to the above address (Controller). ## Scope of data processing The information you provide during the survey will be processed by NIM exclusively for the purpose of evaluating the survey. The results of the evaluation will then be forwarded to the client. The legal basis for the processing of your data is your consent (Art. 6 (1) a) GDPR). Personal data collected in the course of the survey will not be passed on to other third parties unless we are expressly obliged to do so by law. Data processing takes place exclusively within the EU. Personal data is deleted once the purpose for which it was collected no longer applies and in accordance with the statutory deletion periods. If you participate in the survey online, certain technical data, including your IP address, is automatically collected by the servers of our technical service provider Prolific when you access the website ("Usage Data"). In this respect, the technical service provider acts upon our commissioning and instruction. The Usage Data will not be processed for the purpose of evaluating the survey. For further details, please refer to the privacy policy of the service provider: https://researcher-help.prolific.co/hc/en-gb/articles/360009094594-Data-protection-and-privacy ## Data Subject Rights According to the GDPR, various rights are available to data subjects. These include, in particular , the right to information pursuant to Article 15 GDPR, the right to rectification pursuant to Article 16 GDPR, the right to request the restriction of the processing of personal data concerning you pursuant to Article 18 GDPR, the right to erasure pursuant to Article 17 GDPR and the right to data portability pursuant to Article 20 GDPR. In accordance with the GDPR, data subjects also have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. ## Right of objection In the event that your personal data is processed on the basis of legitimate interests pursuant to Art. 6 (1) (f) GDPR, you have the right to object to the processing of your personal data pursuant to Art. 21 GDPR, provided that there are grounds for doing so that arise from your particular situation or the objection is directed against direct advertising. In the latter case, you have a general right to object, which is implemented without specifying a particular situation. ## General Privacy Statement of NIM General information on data proctection at NIM can be found at https://www.nim.org/en/data-protection-declaration.
taskbody.data_protection_check_caption: I agree to the data protection and privacy statement

taskbody.body: We hope you'll enjoy it!

taskbody.heading: Thank you!
taskbody.body: This is the end!
To get started, we would like to ask you a few questions about yourself.

A.Question: How **old** are you? (Please classify yourself into one of the following groups)

taskbody.body:
### Now comes the main part of the experiment. For this, please imagine the following scenario:

## Hurray!

Congratulations, by a lucky coincidence you have unexpectedly received an amount of NIM-$ 10,000. Your friends recommend that you get a second opinion about a potential investment to optimize your profit. Just recently, you read something about a new financial advisory system, which prompted your couriosity. The system provides financial advice from a financial advisor called Emma that you decided to consult.

Today is the day of your advisory meeting. During the meeting, the advisor will ask you about your financial situation as well as your risk affinity and provide you with an investment portfolio tailored to suit your individual needs.

You are free to decide how much money you would like to invest or not. Remember, money that is not invested will not change in value. Invested money will be subject to fluctuations and can either increase or decrease in value.

**Important:** After making your investment decision, the investment will be simulated. Be aware that you will receive a performance-based payment according to your investment which is added to the general participation compensation of £ 2. The exchange rate is NIM-$ 1 = £ 0.0001.

You will only receive a payout if you complete the questionnaire.

### If you are ready to start your advisory meeting, click „Continue“.

You have successfully completed your advisory meeting. Now we would like to ask you some questions about the interaction with the financial advisor.

First of all, please recall the financial **advisor's eye gaze** and indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1101_a.Question: The advisor was comfortable and not staring at me.

q1101_c.Question: I found the advisor's gaze behavior normal and not unnatural.

q1101_d.Question: The advisor's gaze was intentional and not purely random.

q1101_e.Question: I thought the advisor's gaze was natural.

q1101_f.Question: The advisor looked in my direction more often than away from me.

q1101_g.Question: The advisor looked directly at me.

q1101_h.Question: The advisor made eye contact with me.

q1101_j.Question: The advisor looked me in the eye.

taskbody.body:
{{#textonly}}You have successfully completed your advisory meeting. Now we would like to ask you some questions about the interaction with the financial advisor.

{{/textonly}}Please recall the interaction with the financial advisor in general. While you were interacting with the advisor, how much ...

q1110_a.Question: ... did you feel as if the advisor were an intelligent being?

q1110_b.Question: ... did you feel as if the advisor were a social being?

q1110_c.Question: ... did you feel as if the advisor were communicating with you?

q1110_d.Question: ... attention did you pay to the advisor?

q1110_e.Question: ... did you feel involved with the advisor?

taskbody.body:
What about your impression of the financial advisor? How much do you agree with the following statements?

The advisor ...

q1120_e.Question: ... has a mind of its own.

taskbody.body: Now, please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements regarding the expertise of the financial advisor.

q1130_a.Question: I felt that the advisor knew what to do.

q1130_b.Question: I believe the advisor is competent.

q1130_c.Question: I think that the advisor is proficient.

q1130_d.Question: In my opinion, the advisor is trained.

q1130_e.Question: In my opinion, the advisor is experienced.

q1130_f.Question: I believe that the advisor is knowledgeable.

taskbody.body: What effect did the advisor have on you? Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements regarding the overall interaction.

q1140_a.Question: I believe that the advisor would act in my best interest.

q1140_b.Question: If I required help, the advisor would do everything to help me.

q1140_c.Question: The advisor is interested in my well-being, not just the company's.

q1140_e.Question: I would characterize the advisor as honest.

q1140_f.Question: The advisor would keep all its commitments.

q1140_g.Question: The advisor is sincere and genuine.

q1140_h.Question: The advisor is effective in providing financial advice.

q1140_i.Question: The advisor performs the role of giving financial advice very well.

q1140_j.Question: Overall, the advisor is a capable and proficient financial advice provider.

q1140_k.Question: In general, the advisor is very knowledgeable about finance.

taskbody.body: How did you experience the interaction with the advisor? Below you can find opposing adjective pairs. Please put your cross near the respective adjective that reflects your opinion most.
Now let's continue with your memory of the interaction. Please try to remember and answer the following questions.

q1160.Question: What gender was the financial advisor?

q1170.Question: What was the name of the financial advisor?

q1180.Question: How much money would you have lost during the fictional market crash?

q1190.Question: What other kind of financial products besides stocks and bonds were included in your recommended portfolio?

q1200.Question: According to your advisor, in what range was the expected return of your investment?

taskbody.body: Now we would like to know how you experienced the investment task. For that, please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements regarding the overall interaction with your advisor.

q1210_a.Question: I always immediately understood what to do next.

q1210_b.Question: I think the task was easy.

q1210_c.Question: I felt competent enough to comply with the required tasks.

q1210_d.Question: I was completely focused on the advisor's instructions.

taskbody.body:
At the end of the advisory meeting you received a recommendation from the advisor. How relevant was the investment recommendation for you? Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

The investment recommendation of the financial advisor ...

q1220_a.Question: ... made my investment decision more simple.

q1220_b.Question: ... made my investment decision more convenient.

q1220_c.Question: ... is likely to lead to the desired investment outcome.

q1220_d.Question: ... led to a new relevant investment portfolio.

taskbody.body: After the recommendation of the financial advisor, you made an investment decision. Please recall your decision and indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1230_b.Question: I am comfortable with my decision.

q1230_c.Question: My decision is the right one for my situation.

q1230_d.Question: I am satisfied with my decision.

q1230_e.Question: It was easy to make a choice.

taskbody.body: After the recommendation of the financial advisor, you made an investment decision. Please recall your decision and indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1240_a.Question: I had no problem using the information.

q1240_b.Question: The information was easy to understand.

q1240_c.Question: There was enough information. More information would not have helped.

q1240_d.Question: Consulting the financial advisor was a good decision. Consulting someone else would not have been more helpful.

q1240_e.Question: I was glad I made the decision myself. I don't wish someone else would have made the decision for me.

taskbody.body: All in all, how satisfied are you with the financial advisory system? Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements regarding the overall advisory meeting.

q1250_a.Question: I am satisfied with the advisor's overall performance.

q1250_b.Question: The advisor's performance met my expectation.

q1250_c.Question: My level of satisfaction with the advisor is quite close to my ideal advisor's.

taskbody.body: Now we would like to know how likely it is that you would recommend the advisory system. To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?

q1260_a.Question: I will say positive things about the advisor to other people.

q1260_b.Question: I will recommend the advisor to someone who seeks my advice.

q1260_c.Question: I will encourage friends and relatives to seek the advisor's recommendation.

taskbody.body:
Thank you very much for your assessment of the financial advisory system. Now we would like to learn more about your **experiences in general**.

For this purpose, please answer the following questions.

q1270.Question: Have you consulted a personal financial advisor (including via phone or internet) at a bank or savings bank or a financial advisor on a fee basis during the last two years?

q1280.Question: Have you used a robo-advisor, i_e. an automated financial advice where you received an investment suggestion, a sample portfolio, or an investment recommendation based on simple investor profiles and risk tolerances (e.g. at Betterment, Wealthfront, E*TRADE Core, your bank or savings bank) during the last two years?

taskbody.body: We would like to know how familiar you are with robots in general. Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1290_a.Question: I have studied or worked with robots.

q1290_b.Question: I have experience in interacting with robots.

taskbody.body: What about your affinity for technology? Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1300_a.Question: I like to occupy myself in greater detail with technical systems.

q1300_b.Question: I like testing the functions of new technical systems.

q1300_c.Question: It is not enough for me that a technical system works; I want to know how or why it works.

q1300_d.Question: It is not enough for me to know the basic functions of a technical system. I'm also interested in the special functions.

taskbody.body: We are also interested in your ability to remember things in general. Please indicate your level of agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

q1310_a.Question: I am good at remembering the content of news articles and broadcasts.

q1310_b.Question: I am good at remembering conversations I have had.

q1310_c.Question: I am good at remembering the order in which events occured.

q1310_d.Question: I am good at remembering titles of books, films, and plays.

q1310_e.Question: I am usually able to remember exactly where I read or heard a specific thing.

taskbody.body: How would you rate your financial knowledge? Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1320_a.Question: I am well informed about the financial market.

q1320_c.Question: I am well informed about major economic news that impacts the stock market.

q1320_d.Question: I have a high level of financial knowledge.

taskbody.body: This section deals with financial understanding. For this purpose, please answer the following questions.

q1330.Question: Suppose you had $100 in a savings account and the interest rate was 2% per year. After 5 years, how much would you have in the account if you left the money to grow?

q1340.Question: Imagine that the interest rate on your savings account was 1% per year and inflation was 2% per year. After 1 year, how much would you be able to buy with the money in this account?

q1350.Question: Please tell whether this statement is true or false: "Buying a single company's stock usually provides a safer return than a stock mutual fund."

taskbody.body: Finally, we would like to ask you three questions about yourself.

q1360.Question: What is the highest degree or level of school you have completed? (Please classify yourself into one of the following groups)

q1370.Question: How would you describe your current **financial situation**?
options: I am well off and able to afford a number of things.
On the whole, I can manage.
I manage to make ends meet.

q1380.Question: Which category best describes you?
options: White (e.g. Gernan, Irish, English, Italian, Polish, French, etc.)
Hispanic, Latino or Spanish origin (e.g. Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Salvadoran, Dominican, Colombian, etc.)
Black or African American (e.g. African American, Jamaican, Haitian, Nigerian, Ethiopian, Somalian, etc.)
Asian (e.g. Chinese, Filipino, Asian Indian, Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese, etc.)
American Indian or Alaska Native (e.g. Navajo nation, Blackfeet tribe, Mayan, Aztec, Native Village or Barrow Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, etc.)
Middle Eastern or North African (e.g. Lebanese, Iranian, Egyptian, Syrian, Moroccan, Algerian, etc.)
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (e.g. Native Hawaiian, Samoan, Chamorro, Tongan, Fijian, etc.)

taskbody.body: **{{#did_not_spend}}You decided not to invest any money. How do you evaluate this investment decision{{/did_not_spend}}{{^did_not_spend}}How do you evaluate your investment decision after seeing the result of your investment{{/did_not_spend}}?** Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements.

q1400_a.Question: I am satisfied with my investment decision.

q1400_b.Question: I made the right investment decision.

q1400_c.Question: If I had to make the investment decision again, I would make the same investment decision.

taskbody.body:
Thank you very much for your participation in our experiment.

In the following, you will see how your final payout is composed.

Your total payout consists of a general participation compensation and an amount based on the performance of your investment.

The performance based amount is calculated like this:

 ![](formula.png)

___

General participation compensation: £ 2.00

Performance based amount: £ {{performance_based_payout_fmt}}

____________________________

**Total: £ {{payout_fmt}}**

Once all participants have completed this study, you will receive your total payout in real-world currency in the following form:

### You will receive **£ 3.00 when your participation is approved{{#has_bonus_payment}}, plus £ {{bonus_payment_amount_fmt}} as a bonus payment on Prolific{{/has_bonus_payment}}**.

__________

To finish and submit your results, please click "Finish"
